topic.title: Creating an Object Server Resource Group

body.p: Create a resource group for Swift object servers as follows:

ul.li: Identity the control plane that the object serves are associated with (usually data/control_plane.yml)
Identity the node type/role used by Swift Object servers. In this document, we have used ROLE_SWOBJ

Add an entry to the resources item in the control-plan as follows:control-planes: - name: ccp region: region1 . . . resources: . . . - name: swobj resource-prefix: swobj server-role: ROLE-SWOBJ allocation-policy: strict min-count: 0 service-components: - ntp-client - swift-object

body.p: A Swift object server requires the following service components:
The following service components may optionally be added:

ul.li: swift-client. This installs the python-swiftclient package on the server.

body.p: Resource groups do not have a member count attribute. So the number of servers allocated is that the same as the number found with a matching server role.
